intro.title: How did we end up here?
intro.description:
It all starts with a bunch of old photos (and yes, some of them probably should have stayed hidden in the drawers...). You'll find us as kids, with funny faces, awkward poses, and outfits that today would only be trendy... on Mars. Then came the years when we met and, day by day, we began to write our story. The rest? Trips, hugs, crazy moments, and memories that brought us to where we are today. Here we are: a mix of tender, funny, and unforgettable moments.

Explore and... have fun!

outro.title: Next stop: wedding!
outro.description: And yes, this time no questionable outfits... maybe.

chiara_neonata.title: Ta daaa
chiara_neonata.description: Chiara: "For the closest ones I was 'moon face' 🌝🌙✨ and with those little eyes 👀 I really knew how to win over my audience 🎭"

chiara_simone_battesimo.title: March 30, 1986 ✨
chiara_simone_battesimo.description: It was Easter night, and without knowing it, just a few kilometers apart, we were both receiving the sacrament of Baptism... definitely something we have in common 😅

chiara_piccola_famiglia.title: August with family
chiara_piccola_famiglia.description: Chiara: "Vintage clothes 👗, 80s hairstyles 💇‍♀️... a pacifier 🍼 and a diaper 🧷 for a truly amazing team 💪👨‍👩‍👧"

simone_piccolo_calcio.title: Left-footed shot!
simone_piccolo_calcio.description: Simone: "I couldn’t speak well yet 🗣️, but with that left foot ⚽️👟 I made myself perfectly clear."

chiara_piccola_primavera.title: Smiles and adventure
chiara_piccola_primavera.description: Chiara: "Always a little explorer 🧭, with a mischievous look 😉. I love diving into and adventuring through nature 🌿🍃... but keep me away from anything that flies 🐝🦟 or... I go full Marcell Jacobs mode!! 🏃‍♀️💨"

simone_nonni.title: Grandparents, joy and cheer
simone_nonni.description:
Simone: "I was really lucky to have such special grandparents. Grandma Vittoria lovingly cared for us when mom and dad were at work, Grandma Antonietta gathered us every Sunday with her homemade fettuccine 🍝, and with Grandpa Gennaro there were always adventures and pranks 😄. I have no memories of Grandpa Nando (who’s holding me here), but stories and photos tell of a sweet and affectionate grandpa."
Chiara: "Grandpa Gennaro was truly a grandpa to me from the very beginning 🧓❤️... He loved me so much, a genuine and sincere love, shown countless times 🤗. Between cheeky phone calls ☎️, hugs, laughter 😂 and natural complicity ✨, spending a few hours together was always great fun!"

chiara_piccola_natale.title: Merry Christmas!
chiara_piccola_natale.description: Chiara: "And there it is! 😳📸 The classic face I made out of embarrassment when posing for photos! And that little red Christmas dress 🎄👗 fits perfectly!"

simone_venezia.title: Between art and crumbs
simone_venezia.description:
Simone: "Me, a tourist in Venice 🛶, in the company of greedy pigeons at a crumb buffet 🐦🥖!
Below, a little medieval knight… armed only with oversized glasses 🏰👓."

simone_piccolo_papa.title: On a trip with Dad
simone_piccolo_papa.description: Simone: "Me and Dad, rookie mountain hikers 🏞️... with outfits planned down to the last detail: high socks 🧦, matching shorts 🩳 and a strategic cap 🧢."

chiara_piccola_nonni.title: Grandparents: precious roots
chiara_piccola_nonni.description: Chiara: "Some worked the land 🌾, others had the chance to study 📚: my grandparents were simple people with big hearts ❤️. I didn’t have the honor or luck to truly know them all (like Grandpa Bruno), except through the stories of those who shared important and fun moments with them 😊. Of others, like Grandpa Arnaldo — for us 'Grandpa Nnnardo' — I only keep very faint and tiny memories 🕰️. My grandmothers, Amelia and Clara, on the other hand, were always very present 👵👵: two great women! They gave me so much love 💕 and, with their sometimes naturally funny spontaneity 😄, plenty of laughter too! 😂"

simone_piccolo_fratelli.title: The (almost) complete team
simone_piccolo_fratelli.description: Simone: "Here we are: me, Lorenzo, and Gloria 👶👦👧... with the legendary 90s onesies 👕, strictly passed from brother to brother… and from brother to sister! 🔁😂"

simone_asilo_premio.title: Quiz and red socks
simone_asilo_premio.description: Simone: "I don’t know which was bigger: my trophy 🏆 or the courage to wear those red shorts 🔴🩳."

chiara_giovane_fratelli.title: Siblings in the ring
chiara_giovane_fratelli.description: Chiara: "The perfect photo to prove that sibling love 💞 can also include... a bit of wrestling 🤼‍♂️😄!"

simone_cugini.title: A few cousins!
simone_cugini.description: Simone: "Here we are: siblings, cousins 👨‍👩‍👦‍👦… and strictly unsynchronized looks 👀😅."

chiara_simone_gmg.title: Who would have thought?
chiara_simone_gmg.description: Simone: "Tor Vergata, World Youth Day 2000 🌟, a night under the stars ✨. There I was, in the foreground, not imagining anything... and right behind me, sitting calmly 😌, was Chiara! 💕 We didn’t know each other yet, but we were already sleeping bag neighbors 🛌💫."

chiara_simone_brace.title: Grill me again
chiara_simone_brace.description: Simone: "Chiara and I, the perfect partners at every barbecue 🍖👩‍❤️‍👨. From beginners to expert fire masters 🔥🍴🥩."

chiara_simone_argentario.title: Between rocks and sun
chiara_simone_argentario.description: Simone: "Here we were at Argentario ☀️🌊 and as always... no fancy umbrellas or fine sand: just us, true sea lovers 🐚, among rocks 🪨, wind 💨 and sore but satisfied feet 🦶😌."

chiara_simone_mare_mosso.title: Waves and strategic escapes
chiara_simone_mare_mosso.description:
Simone: "At Baia di Riaci, rough sea and giant waves 🌊... guess who immediately runs away as soon as a wave shows up? 🏃‍♀️💨"
Chiara: "It’s not running away, it’s survival! 😤"

chiara_simone_laurea.title: Anxiety, sweat, and important milestones
chiara_simone_laurea.description: 🎓 Memorable snapshots capturing the first but fundamental milestones of our life: our bachelor’s and master’s degrees. 📚 And today you’ve got one more engineer 🛠️ and one more psychologist 🧠 around you... Congratulations to us! 🥳🎉

chiara_bruno.title: Big brother on permanent duty
chiara_bruno.description: Chiara: "Looking at these photos, you could say Bruno was a very caring brother 🤗, always there, carrying me in his arms... especially around (EHHHH)! As for the pranks and mischief 🙈, we won’t talk about that. Today we celebrate only the sweet side... while it lasts! 😇"

simone_fratelli_tutti.title: Team De Cristofaro
simone_fratelli_tutti.description: Simone: "Marco’s First Communion ✨. One of the rare photos where all of us siblings are actually together 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦😅."

chiara_simone_marco_giulia.title: Our little adventure buddies 🧒👧
chiara_simone_marco_giulia.description:
Chiara: "From the sea 🏖️, to the mountains ⛰️, from the scorching August streets ☀️🔥 to the most remote trails 🥾, as kids Giulia and Marco were always ready to follow us."
Simone: "Let’s not forget that time at the Marmore Falls 💧, with Giulia coming down with a high fever 🤒 the next day!"

chiara_papa.title: My dad
chiara_papa.description: Chiara: "And then there’s him, my beloved dad 💖: another pillar in my life, actually my 'listening pillar'! 🎧 Over the years he’s endured endless hours of me rehearsing any topic imaginable 📖, from school tests 📚 to university exams 🎓. With all the diplomas and degrees I’ve collected, by now he should have quite the collection of honorary degrees 🏅 to hang on the wall!"

chiara_simone_snorkeling.title: Extreme snorkeling!
chiara_simone_snorkeling.description: Simone: "It all starts with a mask 🤿, two fins 🩴 and a wooden stick 🪵. Then comes the octopus operation 🐙: spotting 👀, catching 🤲, cleaning 🧼 and... cooking 🍽️! Ultra-sustainable fishing! 👌😁"

chiara_simone_giordana.title: Princess 👑
chiara_simone_giordana.description: Simone: "Giordana is the youngest in the family 👧✨ and with her strong personality 😎 she definitely doesn’t go unnoticed!"

chiara_grazia.title: Sisters by 'chance', 'tatine' by choice
chiara_grazia.description: Chiara: "Tata and tatina... With 13 years between us, for me she was necessarily a bit like a mom 🤱, a safe harbor from Bruno’s teasing ⚓, a partner in mischief 😇😈... always a unique and (above all) loud presence in my life 📢... And yes... from the very moment she steps out of bed while I’m still half asleep... somebody stop herrr 🛌🚫😂"

chiara_mamma.title: Mamy and I 👩‍👧💗
chiara_mamma.description: Chiara: "One of my two pillars... So much of what I have I owe to her 💕. The 'poor one', alas, has always paid the high price of her tough mission as a mom 👩‍👧‍👦 to a daughter: keeping at bay the tomboyish, chaotic whirlwind 😅🎢 inside her... A truly titanic feat 💥🫣"

chiara_laura.title: Group selfie
chiara_laura.description: Chiara: "Vacations 🏖️, pizzas 🍕, concerts 🎶, Christmas 🎄... any occasion was good for a selfie 🤳. And when Bruno was behind the camera 📸, one thing was certain: his chin was destined to play the lead role 😅."

chiara_cugini.title: Uncles and cousins
chiara_cugini.description: Chiara: "Precious childhood playmates 🧸 who, even if growing up in parallel, stay in our lives forever: cousins! The very first friends we have as kids 👧👦. And next to them, the uncles: special presences ✨ who are a bit guides, a bit accomplices 🤝, able to give sincere affection 💖, precious advice 💡 and two open arms ready to hold you tight 🤗"

chiara_cari.title: Loved ones
chiara_cari.description: Chiara: "...Then there are special figures who don’t need titles to be defined: whether by blood, chosen, or found along the way, they all share the ability to make us feel unique 💞. They know how to spoil us with affection 💝, surprise us with complicity 🤝, and remain steady points in our lives 🌟, part guide and part partners in laughter 😂. Presences that transform family into something even greater and more precious 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦✨."

chiara_simone_francesco.title: Wi-Fi, affection, and elbow jabs 🎮❤️💥
chiara_simone_francesco.description:
Simone: "We play co-op online 🎮... but sitting side by side, like two LAN gamers from 2003 🧑‍💻🧑‍💻. Francesco is the pro 🧠, I’m the one bringing the ammo 💼. But with style, of course 😎."
Chiara: "Francesco has a unique talent: he can look adorable 😊, furious 😡, and dangerous 💣... all within three seconds!"

chiara_giovanni_paolo.title: Caresses you never forget
chiara_giovanni_paolo.description: Chiara: "As a teenager I did service in church and thanks to that I had the chance to have a truly unique encounter... the one with Saint John Paul II. I treasure the memory of his smile and his gestures of tenderness."

chiara_simone_montagna.title: Backpacks on, bug spray in pocket 🦟
chiara_simone_montagna.description:
Simone: "Besides the sea, every now and then we also treat ourselves to some peace in the mountains 🏔️. Breathtaking views 😍, clean air 🍃, no sand in our shoes 👟... super relaxing."
Chiara: "Relaxing?! 😤 Speak for yourself. Nature is beautiful, sure! But it’s a constant run from wasps 🐝, spiders 🕷️, or some other unidentified creature 👾 that decides to land on my head!"

chiara_domenico_giovanni.title: Per aspera ad Astra
chiara_domenico_giovanni.description: Chiara: "With Dome and Gio, an extraordinary friendship born by chance ❤️, between ‘monsoons’ 🌊 and ‘walls’ on the beach volleyball court at Baia di Riaci (in Calabria) 🏐☀️. A special bond that goes beyond time and space ✨🪐! My twins, my guardian angels."

chiara_simone_noi1.title: A bit of us...
chiara_simone_noi1.description: Chiara: "Motorbike rides 🏍️, trips ✈️, Christmas 🎄 and elegant evenings 💃..."

chiara_simone_noi2.title: ... A bit more
chiara_simone_noi2.description:
Simone: "Waterfalls, beaches, night scooter rides… and the Angel Flight 🚀 🪂.
That brilliant idea of throwing yourself attached to a cable between two mountains.
For those curious about how it went (this photo was taken just moments before):
Watch the video 😎"

chiara_simone_london.title: From Stonehenge 🌫️ to the Death Star 🚀
chiara_simone_london.description:
Chiara: "Classic London tour: monuments 🏰, walks 🚶‍♀️, double-decker buses 🚌... and a laser duel with Darth Vader, just to top it off."
Simone: "The butterbeer was great 🍺✨"

chiara_simone_ka1.title: Germany 🥨 part 1
chiara_simone_ka1.description:
Simone: "In 2017 I was sent for two months to Karlsruhe to work with German colleagues… and Chiara came with me!
Every weekend was the perfect chance to explore the city and its surroundings 🏙️🌳.

Probably one of the most beautiful chapters ever ❤️."

chiara_simone_ka2.title: Germany 🍺 part 2
chiara_simone_ka2.description: Chiara: "Some of our destinations were 🚆🚌: Strasbourg, Stuttgart, Heidelberg (with its peculiar 220,000-liter wine barrel 🍷!), Baden (with its wonderful landscapes and tulip fields 🌸🌷)... In short, long walks from morning to evening 🥾📸!"

chiara_simone_mare.title: The sea, our way ☀️🏖️
chiara_simone_mare.description:
Our holidays in Salento? A sea-view tour de force:
early wake-ups, backpack on, trekking along the coast, snorkeling, and collapsing at the end of the day. Anything but relaxing!

chiara_simone_madonna_miracolo.title: The little Roman Lourdes
chiara_simone_madonna_miracolo.description: The altar of Our Lady of the Miracle, in the Basilica of Sant’Andrea delle Fratte. A place of prayer, faith, beauty, and meaning, which preserves the memory of an extraordinary event that took place on January 20, 1842: the apparition of the Virgin Mary and the conversion of the young Alphonse Ratisbonne. Today this place is also a fundamental part of our journey of faith, together with the Minims fathers and our consecrated brothers.

intro.title2: Sanctuary of Our Lady of the Miracle
intro.subtitle: A special corner of Rome, between art and spirituality.
intro.description: We are just a stone's throw from Piazza di Spagna, but here, as soon as you step inside, it feels like entering another dimension: silence, art, spirituality. A true hidden gem.

origin.title: Origins and History
origin.p1: The name "delle Fratte" comes from the fact that, once upon a time, this area was full of gardens and brambles.
origin.p2: The church already existed in medieval times, but it was in the 17th century that it was rebuilt by the great architect Borromini, who also designed the beautiful dome and bell tower.

angels.title: The Angels
angels.description1: Among the most striking elements of the church are two angels sculpted by Gian Lorenzo Bernini, originally intended for Ponte Sant'Angelo. Considered too beautiful to remain outdoors, they were brought here to be preserved.
angels.description2: One angel holds the crown of thorns, a symbol of Christ's suffering; the other displays the cartouche with the inscription 'INRI' (Iēsus Nazarēnus Rēx Iūdaeōrum), placed on the cross.

miracle.title: The Miracle of the Apparition
miracle.description1: "[...] the whole church darkened, except for a single chapel that radiated with the most vivid brilliance, and I saw on the altar standing alive, tall, majestic, beautiful, and full of mercy, the Most Blessed Virgin Mary [...]
miracle.description2: At this sight, I fell to my knees where I was. [...] I could barely fix my gaze on Mary's hands, and in them I saw the expression of forgiveness and mercy.
miracle.description3: [...] although she said no words to me, I fully understood the horror of the state I was in, the beauty of the Catholic religion, in a word, I understood everything."

ratisbonne.title: The Conversion of Ratisbonne
ratisbonne.description1: On January 20, 1842, a young French Jew named Alphonse Ratisbonne, known for his deep skepticism and anti-Christian stance, entered Sant'Andrea delle Fratte seemingly by chance. He had accepted a friend's dare to wear the Miraculous Medal, but what happened next changed his life forever: at the side altar, he saw the Virgin Mary.
ratisbonne.description2: The experience moved him so profoundly that he converted to Catholicism, became a Jesuit priest, and dedicated his life to spreading the faith. His conversion, recognized as miraculous, became a powerful symbol of Marian devotion in the Church.

medal.subtitle: A symbol of faith, grace and spiritual protection
medal.description1: The Miraculous Medal was given to Alphonse Ratisbonne by his friend, Baron Théodore de Bussières, who challenged him to wear it. This medal originates from the apparitions of the Virgin Mary to Saint Catherine Labouré in 1830. Mary revealed its design and promised great graces to those who would wear it with faith.
medal.description2: On the back are twelve stars, symbolizing Mary's crown, surrounding a large 'M' intertwined with a cross. Below are the Sacred Hearts of Jesus and Mary: one crowned with thorns, the other pierced by a sword.

0.title: Custodians of Sant'Andrea delle Fratte
0.description: The church has been cared for by the Minims since 1585, the year Pope Sixtus V entrusted its administration to them. Since then, the friars have dedicated themselves to prayer and service, faithfully preserving the spiritual and artistic heritage of Sant'Andrea delle Fratte.

1.title: In the Shadow of the Rock
1.description: Francesco was born in 1416 in Paola, a town in Calabria, southern Italy. Devout from a young age and chose to live as a hermit in a cave near his hometown. Embracing solitude, prayer, and extreme poverty, he attracted followers drawn to his radical lifestyle of humility and penance. This would eventually lead to the birth of the Order of Minims.

2.title: A Life of Miracles and Mercy
2.description: San Francesco was known for miraculous acts: healing the sick, multiplying loaves, and even walking on water using his cloak. Among his many wonders, one of the most beloved is the story of Martinello, a little lamb who followed him like a friend. When the lamb was unknowingly slaughtered, cooked, and served by a worker, Francesco wept and prayed and Martinello miraculously returned to life, a tender symbol of his compassion for all creation.

3.title: Living the Mission Today
3.description: The Minims friars who live today at Sant'Andrea delle Fratte embody the spirit of their founder with kindness and joy. Always ready to greet, listen, and guide, they cultivate a welcoming environment through prayer, conversation, and community activities. Their simple yet radiant presence continues to inspire and bring people closer to faith in everyday life.

4.title: Did You Know They Don't Eat Meat?
4.description: The Minims are the only religious order that, in addition to the vows of poverty, chastity, and obedience, observe a fourth vow: "perpetual Lent", which means abstaining from meat and animal products. This choice embodies penance, sobriety, and daily conversion—renouncing excess to place God at the center and walk in solidarity with the poor and suffering.

church.title: How to reach the church
church.intro: The ceremony will take place at Sant'Andrea delle Fratte, located in the heart of Rome, just a few steps from the Spanish Steps.

parking.title: Parking Information
parking.note: Please note that on Friday, October 10th, at 3:00 PM, the area around the church is within the ZTL (Limited Traffic Zone). We kindly recommend that you park your vehicle outside the ZTL and reach the church on foot.

description.01: A pleasant walk through the historic center. Estimated walking time: 15 minutes.
description.02: From the parking area, take the underpass that leads directly to the Spagna metro station (Line A). From there, cross Piazza di Spagna keeping to the left, passing the statue of the Madonna in the center of the square. Continue for a few more minutes to reach the church of Sant'Andrea delle Fratte.

description.01: A slightly closer option, with an estimated walking time of about 10 minutes.
description.02: From the parking area, take Via Francesco Crispi to the left, then follow Via Capo delle Case, which leads directly to the church of Sant'Andrea delle Fratte.
description.03: Please note that the return route is uphill, especially in the final stretch, so we recommend taking your time.

parking.recommendation: We recommend allowing extra time to enjoy the walk and avoid any stress.

reception.title: How to reach the reception venue
reception.intro: The reception will take place at Park Hotel Villa Ferrata, an elegant villa surrounded by a centuries-old park, located in a quiet area just outside Rome.

venue.title: Venue information
venue.note: The venue is easily accessible by car and offers ample parking space for all guests.

transport.title: By Car
transport.description: The drive from the church to the venue takes about 45–60 minutes, passing through the center of Rome and continuing southeast. We recommend following the route that goes through Via Cavour and Via Merulana, then onto the Tangenziale Est, and finally the Grande Raccordo Anulare, exiting at Tuscolana/Grottaferrata.

venue.recommendation: We recommend planning your trip in advance, especially during peak hours, to ensure a smooth arrival.

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
paragraphs: Pursuant to Article 13 of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (GDPR), we inform you that the personal data collected through this website will be processed as described below. The data controller is Simone De Cristofaro (email: info@chiaraesimone.it).

Categories of data may include: name, email address, phone number (if provided), and any other information voluntarily entered in the contact form or comments section. Technical data (e.g., IP address, device/browser metadata) may be processed for security and anti-spam purposes (e.g., reCAPTCHA, if enabled).

Purposes of processing:
  • Contact replies: to respond to messages sent via the contact form.
  • Comments & notifications: to publish your comments and, if you opt in, send notifications about new comments related to the same photo or story.
  • Security & anti-spam: to protect the service from abuse and spam (e.g., via reCAPTCHA, if enabled).
  • Site operation: to ensure security and proper functioning of the website.

Legal bases: (a) our legitimate interest in responding to your request (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR); (b) your consent for publishing comments and sending email notifications, where applicable (Art. 6(1)(a) GDPR); (c) our legitimate interest in ensuring security and preventing abuse (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR). Where consent is the basis, you may withdraw it at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing before withdrawal.

Providing data is optional. However, an email address is necessary to reply to your contact request or to send you notifications if you opt in. Without the required data, some features may not be available.

Recipients/Processors: we use trusted service providers for hosting and email delivery (e.g., AWS services primarily within the EU/EEA) and anti-spam (e.g., Google reCAPTCHA, if enabled). These providers process data on our behalf under appropriate data-protection agreements. Please refer to their privacy policies for details.

Data location and transfers: where possible, data are stored within the EU/EEA (e.g., AWS eu-west-1). Some processing (such as email delivery or anti-spam) may involve transfers to countries outside the EU/EEA. In such cases, appropriate safeguards are applied (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses).

Retention: contact-form data are stored only for the time strictly necessary to handle your request and, in any case, no longer than 6 months from receipt. Comment-related data are stored for as long as the comment remains visible on the site or until you request deletion. Email-subscription data are retained until you unsubscribe.

Your rights: you may request access, rectification, erasure, or restriction of processing of your personal data, object to processing, and (where applicable) withdraw consent. To exercise your rights, write to: info@chiaraesimone.it. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the Italian Data Protection Authority (Garante).

Cookies and third-party tools: we do not use analytics cookies. If enabled, Google reCAPTCHA may place cookies strictly necessary for security and anti-spam purposes. The emoji picker used on this site (@ctrl/ngx-emoji-mart) runs entirely in your browser and may store recently used emojis or UI preferences in your device’s localStorage to improve usability; it does not send your personal data to third parties.

Minors: this website is intended for a general audience. If you are under the age required by applicable law to give valid consent, please obtain consent from a parent or guardian before using interactive features.
